intro: Bunchosia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and glandular leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in dry, disturbed habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
